title: Yemen: Protecting sheep and goats against disease

tasks.task: Driving a Loaderillow at a farm.
subtasks: Sit on the loader lift seat.
Reach and pick up the lever to operate the loader.
Apply force to move the lever, raising and lowering the bucket.
Use hands to control the direction and speed of the loader movement.
Look around to assess the immediate surroundings while operating the loader.

tasks.task: Unloading hay from a trailer.
subtasks: Walk to the trailer slowly.
Open the trailer door.
Reach in and pull the hay bag out carefully.
Carry the hay bag across the farm.
Place the hay bag on the ground or in a designated area.

tasks.task: Driving a Case IH tractor.
subtasks: Sit in the tractor seat, adjusting the seat belt if necessary.
Engage the clutch and start the engine.
Use the steering wheel to maneuver the tractor along the fields.
Monitor the direction and pace while driving.
Check the rearview mirror to avoid obstacles.

tasks.task: Watering crops with a portable sprinkler.
subtasks: Walk to the portable sprinkler system.
Connect the water hose to the sprinkler.
Walk through the field while manually turning the sprinkler, directing the water flow.
Ensure coverage of the entire area by adjusting the sprinkler's position.

tasks.task: Filling a bucket with water from a trough.
subtasks: Approach the trough while walking.
Bend down or squat to reach the water level.
Pour water into the bucket, using hand movements.
Stand up and carry the filled bucket.

tasks.task: Shoveling soil onto a soil mixing machine.
subtasks: Walk to the soil mixing machine.
Dig or scoop soil with a shovel.
Transfer the soil from the shovel to the machine hopper, using both hands.
Dispose of the empty shovel and repeat the process as needed.

tasks.task: Pressing hay using a hay press.
subtasks: Prepare the hay to be pressed, spreading it evenly.
Load the hay into the press hopper.
Close the press lid securely.
Activate the hydraulic press mechanism.
Monitor the pressure and ensure the hay is compacted properly.
Remove the pressed bale once compacted.

tasks.task: Securing a bale with twine.
subtasks: Position the bale within reach.
Take a length of twine and wrap it around the bale, securing it tightly.
Tie a knot to fasten the twine securely.

tasks.task: Transporting a bale using a loader.
subtasks: Raise the loader bucket.
Gently lower the bucket around the bale.
Lift the bale into position using the loader.
Drive the truck or trailer to the desired location.
Lower the bale onto the truck bed or the ground.

tasks.task: Loading bales onto a truck bed.
subtasks: Approach the bale stack or pile.
Use the fork of a loader to pick up a bale.
Lift the bale onto the truck bed, centering it.
Release the fork and repeat for subsequent bales.

tasks.task: Shredding hay with a conditioner.
subtasks: Load the hay onto the conditioner.
Activate the conditioner blades and ensure even shredding.
Handle the processed hay afterwards, dispersing it.

tasks.task: Attaching a tool to the tractor.
subtasks: Determine the appropriate implement for the task.
Hook up the tool to the tractor's drawbar or3-point hitch.
Secure all connection points to prevent accidents.

tasks.task: Installing a hydraulic hose on a machine.
subtasks: Identify the correct hydraulic hose for the machine.
Connect the hose to the machine’s interface.
Check the connections for leaks or misalignment.

tasks.task: Operating a skid steer and a spray rig.
subtasks: Sit in the skid steer seat, adjusting for comfort.
Connect a spray hose to the skid steer's hydraulics.
Mount the spray rig onto the skid steer chassis.
Begin spraying the designated area, controlling direction and pressure.

tasks.task: Changing a tire on a tractor.
subtasks: Locate the spare tire and tools.
Jack up the tractor with the jack.
Loosen the affected wheel's lug nuts.
Remove the flat tire and replace it with the spare.
Tighten the lug nuts while the wheel is still elevated.
Lower the tractor and fully tighten the nuts.

tasks.task: Examining crops for pests or disease.
subtasks: Walk through the field to observe plants.
Inspect individual plants for signs of infestation or illness.
Note any areas requiring treatment or intervention.

tasks.task: Preparing soil using a soil turning tool.
subtasks: Operate the machinery to till the soil, moving it along the field.
Adjust the tool's depth and width based on needs.
Monitor the quality of the soil displacement.

tasks.task: Driving a grain cart.
subtasks: Sit in the grain cart seat.
Engage the hydraulic lift to lower it onto the ground.
Connect the grain auger to the combine or shuttle.
Start the grain cart engine and set the speed.
Drive the cart while attending to the grain flow and observing the combine operator.

tasks.task: Performing general field maintenance.
subtasks: Walk through the field to check for debris or obstacles.
Remove any objects that could impede machinery movement.
Apply any necessary repairs or adjustments to the equipment.

tasks.task: Attaching a baler to a tractor.
subtasks: Attach the baler implement to the tractor’s 3-point hitch.
Secure all safety mechanisms and connections.

tasks.task: Feeding hay into a baler.
subtasks: Disassemble baled hay from a trailer.
Load the hay into the baler hopper.
Monitor the baler operation and ensure proper bale formation.

tasks.task: Unloading hay from a baler.
subtasks: Open the baler’s discharge door.
Guide the compacted bales out manually or with a conveyor.
Stack or move the bales to storage or a field.

tasks.task: Driving a skid steer loader.
subtasks: Enter the cab and inspect controls.
Start the engine and adjust the seat.
Navigating the skid steer around terrains, using its steered wheels.
Utilize forks or attachments as needed for loading or unloading.
Control speed and stability while moving loads.

tasks.task: Tilling soil with a disc harrow.
subtasks: Operate the disc harrow attachment on the tractor.
Guide the harrow along the field’s furrows.
Monitor the harrow’s performance and adjust direction or depth as necessary.

tasks.task: Using a sprayer.
subtasks: Set up the sprayer and check the nozzles for clogs or leaks.
Drive through the field, applying the pesticide or herbicide uniformly.
Calibrate the sprayer to maintain optimal coverage and rate.

tasks.task: Interacting with a combine harvester.
subtasks: Approach the combine’s rear or side to monitor its operation.
Note the efficiency and any potential issues such as clogging or loss of grain.
Control the grain cart if needed, ensuring a smooth harvest flow.

tasks.task: Feeding hay to livestock.
subtasks: Bring hay from the storage area to the barn.
Open the barn door and deliver hay to the animals.
Check for wastage and supplement feeding as necessary.

tasks.task: Applying mulch to crops.
subtasks: Load mulch into a spreader machine.
Drive the machine through the rows, dispersing mulch evenly.
Monitor wind direction to avoid drift and ensure coverage.

tasks.task: Handling manure for fertilizer.
subtasks: Collect manure from livestock areas.
Transport the manure to a storage site or application area.
Spread the manure on fields using a spreader.

tasks.task: Repairing a broken tool attachment.
subtasks: Locate the broken part and the necessary tools.
Disassemble the attachment to gain access to the break.
Weld or replace the damaged section.
Reassemble the attachment, ensuring tightness and safety.

tasks.task: Venting a field.
subtasks: Use a tillage tool, like a field plow, to open drainage ditches.
Guide the equipment through the rows, cutting the soil.
Check the depth and alignment of the trenches.
Install drainage tiles if required, covering them to prevent compaction.

tasks.task: Attaching a spinner mower.
subtasks: Position the mower over the tractor's rotating shaft.
Secure the connections and tighteners.
Priming the mower prior to operation.
Adjust the cutting height and test the mower’s operation.

tasks.task: Restocking seed bins on a grain cart.
subtasks: Open the cart’s door and access the seed compartments.
Lift and transfer seed bags into the bins manually.
Close the compartments and secure the doors.

tasks.task: Operating a sprayer during spraying.
subtasks: Drive the sprayer along the rows, maintaining an even speed.
Adjust the spray nozzles or height for optimal coverage.
Monitor the sprayer’s chemical level and refill when necessary.

tasks.task: Installing a new blade on a disc harrow.
subtasks: Unscrew the old blade and replace it with a new one.
Align the new blade properly and secure it with bolts.
Test the new blade’s balance and fit after tightening.

tasks.task: Handling hay bales during transport.
subtasks: Secure the bales in a trailer to prevent sliding.
Check all bale straps or ties for tightness.
Protect bales from the elements during transport, e.g., covering them.

tasks.task: Applying fertilizer using a spreader.
subtasks: Load the spreader with fertilizer.
Adjust the spreader settings based on the field conditions.
Drive through the field, applying fertilizer according to the marks or grid system.
Check for uneven distribution and make adjustments.

tasks.task: Converting a tool attachment.
subtasks: Remove the current implement from the tractor.
Attaching the new implement securely.
Test all connections and control systems.

tasks.task: Operating a feed spreader.
subtasks: Set up the spreader with the appropriate feed type.
Drive through the feeding area, distributing feed uniformly.
Observe the distribution and make adjustments if needed.

tasks.task: Attaching a hay rake.
subtasks: Position the hay rake on the 3-point hitch.
Lower the rake assembly onto the ground.
Operate the machine to collect and arrange hay into windrows.
Ensure the rake’s teeth are properly set for the hay type.

tasks.task: Driving a fertilizer spreader behind a tractor.
subtasks: Connect the spreader to the tractor’s drawbar.
Load the spreader with fertilizer or other agrochemicals.
Drive through the field, maintaining the correct speed and overlap.
Correct any skips or overlaps and adjust the spreading pattern.

tasks.task: Gauging grain moisture with a moisture meter.
subtasks: Collect a sample from the grain stream.
Insert the moisture meter probe into the grain sample.
Read the moisture content and log the results.

tasks.task: Harvesting grain with a combine.
subtasks: Enter the combine cab, adjust seat and safety belts.
Engage the engine and begin moving the combine through the field.
Monitor the cutting height and header operation.
Adjust the combine’s gauge wheels for the prevailing field conditions.
Check the grain tank level and empty or clean it when needed.
Inspect the threshing mechanism and chaff for blockages.
Switch settings for different crops if necessary.

tasks.task: Feeding a tractor’s hydraulic system.
subtasks: Monitor the hydraulic fluid level and top up if necessary.
Inspect the hydraulic lines for leaks or damage.
Change the hydraulic oil according to the maintenance schedule.

tasks.task: Handling grain with an auger loader.
subtasks: Extend the auger to the grain source, such as a bin or storage.
Start the auger and guide the grain into the transport vehicle.
Monitor the auger’s operation and unblock it if necessary.

tasks.task: Allocating hay to different fields.
subtasks: Survey the available fields to determine which needs hay.
Estimate the amount of hay required and plan deliveries.
Coordinate transport and unloading times for efficient storage.

tasks.task: Attaching irrigation pipes to a boomsprinkler.
subtasks: Assemble the necessary pipes and connections.
Secure the pipes to the boomsprinkler frame.
Adjust spray patterns and coverage areas as per the field layout.

tasks.task: Operating a sprayer for application.
subtasks: Dress the sprayer’s components and prepare it for use.
Drive through the field at the recommended speed.
Apply the selected chemicals, monitoring for even distribution.
Refill or change chemical tanks as needed.

tasks.task: Attaching a seed drill to a tractor.
subtasks: Assemble the seed drill on the tractor’s 3-point hitch.
Check the toolbar and seed boxes for proper alignment.
Secure all parts to prevent displacement during operation.

tasks.task: Planting seeds using a grain drill.
subtasks: Position the drill over the ground to be planted.
Operate the drill to open the furrow, deposit seeds, and cover them.
Monitor the planting depth and ensure accurate spacing.

tasks.task: Placing poles for delineation.
subtasks: Walk along the field, determining where poles are needed.
Measure and mark the exact positions for the poles.
Drive or hammer the poles into the ground at the marked spots.

tasks.task: Greasing a piece of farm equipment.
subtasks: Identify the lubrication points on the equipment.
Apply grease manually or with a grease gun.
Ensure all critical moving parts are adequately lubracted.

tasks.task: Driving a Milking Parlor.
subtasks: Approach the parlor to check milk production.
Gently open the stall door to inspect the milking process.
Examine the teats for any issues and the milk for quality.
Record milking data and note any deviations from normal.

tasks.task: Applying a calcium chloride solution to silage.
subtasks: Mix the calcium chloride with the freshly cut grass.
Sprinkle the solution evenly over the silage pile.
Stomp the silage with feet to incorporate the solution.
Ensure the entire surface is treated to prevent spoilage.

tasks.task: Breaking down baled silage.
subtasks: Release the bale grasping device.
Lower the head to open the bale.
Feed the silage through a chute into the silo.
Monitor the process for any jams or leaks.

tasks.task: Operating a manure spreader.
subtasks: Fill the spreader with compost or slurry.
Set the spread pattern and swath width.
Expel the manure onto fields, adjusting direction as necessary.
Scan the spread area for uneven distribution and correct.

tasks.task: Applying duct tape to fix a conveyor belt.
subtasks: Identify the faulty section of the belt.
Tear a length of duct tape sufficient to cover the tear.
Align the belt edges and apply the tape, smoothing it to adhere.
Test the belt by moving it manually to check if repair is sufficient.

tasks.task: Driving a tractor-pulled discer to harrow fields.
subtasks: Attach the disc attachments to the tractor’s drawbar.
Position the discs in the ground to till the soil.
Monitor the depth and furrow quality, adjusting as necessary.

tasks.task: Tying off a plastic covering on a field.
subtasks: Lay down the plastic sheet over the area to be protected.
Cut the sheet to fit the coverage area precisely.
Secure the edges of the plastic using soil, rocks, or stakes.
Ensure the covering is taut and free from disruptions.

tasks.task: Operating a loader to prepare a field for planting.
subtasks: Remove existing debris or old crop residue.
Load the debris into a trailer or spread it elsewhere.
Till the soil, breaking up clumps and distributing nutrients.
Smooth the surface so it is level for planting.

tasks.task: Handling a roll of hemp material.
subtasks: Unroll the material onto the field.
Edge the material with stones or gravel to secure it.
Stagger overlaps to prevent gaps and ensure coverage.
Fix any tears or openings in the material.

tasks.task: Using a sloper to check the field’s contour.
subtasks: Put the sloper in place and take a reading.
Document the slope percentage at multiple points.
Use this data to model contours for better irrigation or drainage.

tasks.task: Operating a skid steer as a tiller.
subtasks: Choose the appropriate tiller attachments for the skid steer.
Secure the tiller to the skid steer's front or back.
Maneuver around the field, turning over and mixing the soil.
Monitor the tiller’s performance, adjusting as needed.

tasks.task: Adjusting shades on a hayloft.
subtasks: Ascend to the hayloft using a ladder or elevating platform.
Move each shade to the desired position to control light and temperature.
Check shades for wear and replace if necessary.

tasks.task: Pulling a trailer attached to a tractor.
subtasks: Ensure the trailer is properly coupled to the tractor.
Check the brakes, lights, and coupling points.
Drive the tractor-trailer formation to the destination.
Stop to check for stability and any issues while moving.

tasks.task: Venting a field of odors.
subtasks: Operate a soil fume blower to release trapped gases.
Secure the blower in the field and connect it to air extracting lines.
Monitor the extraction to ensure efficient odor removal.

tasks.task: Applying herbicides using a sprayer.
subtasks: Mix herbicide solutions in the sprayer tanks.
Drive through the target areas, avoiding wind drift.
Adjust the pressure and nozzle settings for the best coverage.

tasks.task: Planting corn using a planter.
subtasks: Assemble the planter conveyor, tubes, and press wheels.
Adjust the seed depth and spacing to the manufacturer’s recommendations.
Work the planter through the field at the optimal speed.

tasks.task: Preparing to plant a field.
subtasks: Walk through the field to check for rocks, weeds, or debris.
Mark problem areas for removal or treatment.
Communicate with the planting crew about expectations for the day.

tasks.task: Installing a rotation system between crops.
subtasks: Review historical yield data and crop rotation guidelines.
Plan which crops to alternate to maximize soil health and yield.
Document the rotation plan and distribute to relevant staff members.

tasks.task: Attaching a sewer hose to a skid steer.
subtasks: Find the appropriate adapter for attaching the sewer hose to the skid steer.
Connect the hose to the machine’s hydraulic port.
Operate the sewer cleaning attachment attached to the skid steer.
Scrub or vacuum the sewage lines thoroughly.

tasks.task: Inspecting a machine’s cooling systems.
subtasks: Open the radiator or coolant reservoir.
Check the fluid level and condition.
Remove debris or contaminants from the radiator fins.
Refill with the correct coolant if necessary.

tasks.task: Following a farmer through tasks in a greenhouse.
subtasks: Watering plants and ensuring consistent moisture levels.
Pruning dead leaves or stems, removing them carefully.
Applying fertilizer to potted plants using a spray bottle or applicator.
Monitor for pests such as spider mites or aphids and treat as needed.

tasks.task: Driving a tractor with an attachable rototiller.
subtasks: Fix the rototiller onto the tractor’s 3-point hitch.
Start the tractor and begin tilling the soil layer by layer.
Adjust the tillage depth and width according to the soil type.
Check for rocks or obstructions and remove them if present.

tasks.task: Using a sprayer for pesticide application during hot days.
subtasks: Apply pesticides mid-morning or late afternoon when temperatures are milder.
Use a high-pressure sprayer to penetrate dense foliage.
Adjust the spray patterns to cover tall crops effectively.

tasks.task: Operating a light truck for crop transport.
subtasks: Load crops into the bed of the truck, using a fork lift or hand.
Secure cargo with straps or netting to prevent shifting during transit.
Navigate standard roads to the market or processing facility.

tasks.task: Cleaning a combine with high-pressure water.
subtasks: Detach the combine from the grain cart.
Position the combine under a car wash arch or pressure washer.
Spray the combine body with water, removing debris and residue.
Inspect the combine for any repairs before next use.

tasks.task: Assorting crops at a storage facility.
subtasks: Classify harvested crops by variety, size, or ripeness.
Place each crop in its designated area for optimal preservation.
Organize inventory records per crop type and quantity.

tasks.task: Attaching a conditioner to a combine.
subtasks: Attach the header conditioner to the combine’s header.
Align the conditioner’s knives with the crop inlet.
Secure all connections to prevent separation during operation.

tasks.task: Grinding soil samples for analysis.
subtasks: Collect fresh soil samples using a auger or shovel.
Place the soil in a sample bag or container.
Send the samples to a lab for nutrient analysis.
Wait for the results and incorporate recommendations into planting plans.

tasks.task: Securing a chisel to a front-loader.
subtasks: Attach the chisel plow to the loader back or front.
ensure proper alignment with the loader arms.
Secure the chisel with pin locks to avoid it coming off during use.

tasks.task: Inspecting combine exhaust emissions.
subtasks: Check the visible smoke color and rate from the exhaust.
Compare against emission standards for compliance.
Clean or replace the exhaust filter or muffler if needed.

tasks.task: Handling dripping machines.
subtasks: Locate the source of the leak.
Tighten fittings, replace seals, or use a sealant.
Test the machine after repairs to confirm stoppage of leak.
